channel.title: The Central Newfoundland Morning Show from CBC Radio Nfld. and Labrador (Highlights)

image.title: The Central Newfoundland Morning Show from CBC Radio Nfld. and Labrador (Highlights)

channel.description: CBC Radio's Leigh Anne Power in Gander hosts the Central Newfoundland Morning Show. The show provides news along with current affairs items and stories of local interest from urban areas and the diverse rural communities surrounding the two towns.
channel.itunes:author: CBC Radio
channel.itunes:summary: CBC Radio's Leigh Anne Power in Gander hosts the Central Newfoundland Morning Show. The show provides news along with current affairs items and stories of local interest from urban areas and the diverse rural communities surrounding the two towns.

item.title: Winter Whales Spotted in Lewisporte
item.description: Lewisporte's Byron Sheppard saw some whales playing in Lewisporte Harbour this January. We hear from him and DFO's Jack Lawson about how unusual whale sittings are in January.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Lewisporte's Byron Sheppard saw some whales playing in Lewisporte Harbour this January. We hear from him and DFO's Jack Lawson about how unusual whale sittings are in January.
item.itunes:summary: Lewisporte's Byron Sheppard saw some whales playing in Lewisporte Harbour this January. We hear from him and DFO's Jack Lawson about how unusual whale sittings are in January.

item.title: Love on the Rock
item.description: Newfoundland romance author Victoria Barbour talks about her new books and writing love stories in her home province.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Newfoundland romance author Victoria Barbour talks about her new books and writing love stories in her home province.
item.itunes:summary: Newfoundland romance author Victoria Barbour talks about her new books and writing love stories in her home province.

item.title: Bishop's Falls Invest in Tourism
item.description: Bishop's Falls is hoping a huge investment in tourism infrastructure will pay off. We talk to Mayor Bob Hobbs about the plans.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Bishop's Falls is hoping a huge investment in tourism infrastructure will pay off. We talk to Mayor Bob Hobbs about the plans.
item.itunes:summary: Bishop's Falls is hoping a huge investment in tourism infrastructure will pay off. We talk to Mayor Bob Hobbs about the plans.

item.title: Bridges in Repair
item.description: We talk to Environment and Conservation Minister Perry Trimper about how the province will fix the broken bridges along the T'Railway Provincial Park.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk to Environment and Conservation Minister Perry Trimper about how the province will fix the broken bridges along the T'Railway Provincial Park.
item.itunes:summary: We talk to Environment and Conservation Minister Perry Trimper about how the province will fix the broken bridges along the T'Railway Provincial Park.

item.title: Empty Stands for Senior Hockey
item.description: Interest in the Central West Senior Hockey League seems to be waning - judging by the size of the crowds. We ask the head of the league, Neil Norcott, why attendance seems to be dropping.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Interest in the Central West Senior Hockey League seems to be waning - judging by the size of the crowds. We ask the head of the league, Neil Norcott, why attendance seems to be dropping.
item.itunes:summary: Interest in the Central West Senior Hockey League seems to be waning - judging by the size of the crowds. We ask the head of the league, Neil Norcott, why attendance seems to be dropping.

item.title: Health Foundation Receives Generous Donation from Local Union
item.description: The members of the Union of Operating Engineers Local 902 donated $100, 000 to the Central Northeast Health Foundation. We find out why and how the money will be spent.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: The members of the Union of Operating Engineers Local 902 donated $100, 000 to the Central Northeast Health Foundation. We find out why and how the money will be spent.
item.itunes:summary: The members of the Union of Operating Engineers Local 902 donated $100, 000 to the Central Northeast Health Foundation. We find out why and how the money will be spent.

item.title: Gander CYN Finds New Home
item.description: The Community Youth Network is moving from the strip mall to a new location. Executive director Lesley Butler explains how she hopes this will brighten the imagine of the CYN.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: The Community Youth Network is moving from the strip mall to a new location. Executive director Lesley Butler explains how she hopes this will brighten the imagine of the CYN.
item.itunes:summary: The Community Youth Network is moving from the strip mall to a new location. Executive director Lesley Butler explains how she hopes this will brighten the imagine of the CYN.

item.title: T'railway Park Cut in Two
item.description: The province's T'railway Park is cut in two by a condemned bridge. We find out how that is hitting tourism hard from the president of the Newfoundland T'Railway board of directors, Jamie Warren.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: The province's T'railway Park is cut in two by a condemned bridge. We find out how that is hitting tourism hard from the president of the Newfoundland T'Railway board of directors, Jamie Warren.
item.itunes:summary: The province's T'railway Park is cut in two by a condemned bridge. We find out how that is hitting tourism hard from the president of the Newfoundland T'Railway board of directors, Jamie Warren.

item.title: Revitalizing Downtown Gander
item.description: Gander's downtown is full of old, empty spaces where businesses used to be. We ask the Chamber of Commerce what the businesses need to make a comeback.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Gander's downtown is full of old, empty spaces where businesses used to be. We ask the Chamber of Commerce what the businesses need to make a comeback.
item.itunes:summary: Gander's downtown is full of old, empty spaces where businesses used to be. We ask the Chamber of Commerce what the businesses need to make a comeback.

item.title: Northern Arm Turns 125
item.description: The Bay of Exploits town of Northern Arms is 125 years old this year. And they have a load of plans all year to celebrate. Bob Hannaford gives us the details.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: The Bay of Exploits town of Northern Arms is 125 years old this year. And they have a load of plans all year to celebrate. Bob Hannaford gives us the details.
item.itunes:summary: The Bay of Exploits town of Northern Arms is 125 years old this year. And they have a load of plans all year to celebrate. Bob Hannaford gives us the details.

item.title: Big Plans for Tourism in Central Newfoundland
item.description: Caroline Swan of Adventure Central talks about a new report looking at how to boost the industry in our region.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Caroline Swan of Adventure Central talks about a new report looking at how to boost the industry in our region.
item.itunes:summary: Caroline Swan of Adventure Central talks about a new report looking at how to boost the industry in our region.

item.title: Headed for Broke
item.description: The Newfoundland and Labrador economy is in real trouble. We ask the finance minister Cathy Bennett what her government can do to turn it around.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: The Newfoundland and Labrador economy is in real trouble. We ask the finance minister Cathy Bennett what her government can do to turn it around.
item.itunes:summary: The Newfoundland and Labrador economy is in real trouble. We ask the finance minister Cathy Bennett what her government can do to turn it around.

item.title: Rebecca Russell Becomes Head Coach of Clarenville Caribous
item.description: Accomplished hockey player and coach Rebecca Russell has been a lot of firsts. Now, she's the first female head coach in senior hockey. She speaks with the CBC's Leigh Anne Power.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Accomplished hockey player and coach Rebecca Russell has been a lot of firsts. Now, she's the first female head coach in senior hockey. She speaks with the CBC's Leigh Anne Power.

item.title: Party of One Okay for Berni Stapleton
item.description: Comedian Berni Stapleton is stick & tired of being made to feel sad about being single. And this year, she's hoping to start a singles movement with her new blog. She chats with the CBC's Melissa Tobin.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Comedian Berni Stapleton is stick & tired of being made to feel sad about being single. And this year, she's hoping to start a singles movement with her new blog. She chats with the CBC's Melissa Tobin.

item.title: Manzy Speaks
item.description: The GFW rapper who was suspended from high school for using pop props in a music video says he did learn a lesson in all this. We hear from Brad "Manzy" Manual.

item.title: Gander Library Looks for Arabic Books
item.description: The Gander Library is putting a call out for books for the Syrian families headed our way. We talk to Regional Librarian for Central Newfoundland, Courtney Penney.

item.title: Boonie To Shave Beard for ALS
item.description: It's a beard that's been 39 years in the making. But Ralph "Boonie" Lethbridge from Clarenville says the facial hair has got to go... all for a good cause.

item.itunes:subtitle: It's a beard that's been 39 years in the making. But Ralph "Boonie" Lethbridge from Clarenville says the facial hair has got to go... all for a good cause.

item.title: Could Newfoundland and Labrador Go Bankrupt?
item.description: If the province doesn't make drastic changes, it'll almost certainly go broke. We talk to Richard Saillant of the the Canadian Institute for Research on Public Policy at the University of Moncton.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: If the province doesn't make drastic changes, it'll almost certainly go broke. We talk to Richard Saillant of the the Canadian Institute for Research on Public Policy at the University of Moncton.

item.title: Parks Canada Offers Free Admission for 150th Anniversary

item.description: A rap video published online last month got a couple high school hockey players in hot water. That's created a conversation in the public about substance abuse in school sports. We talk to the head of School Sports NL.

item.title: Gander Mayor Calls for More Cops
item.description:
With the rash of break and enters in Gander recently, mayor Claude Elliott says there needs to be more police to help stop the problem.
And we hear from a security expert about tips to keep burglars away.

item.title: New Natural Resources Minister Talks Low Oil Prices

item.title: Why Central Health Has the Highest Numbers of Long Term Care Residents on Unnecessary Anti-Psychotic Drugs in the Country
item.description: In Central Newfoundland, forty-two percent of seniors in homes are on anti-psychotic drugs they don't need. That's considerably higher than the national average of twenty-eight percent.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca

item.title: A Very Boonie Christmas

item.title: Muslim Man in GFW Spreads a Message of Peace
item.description: We talk to Dr. Mohamed Boodhun, a practising Muslim in Grand Falls - Windsor, about promoting peace between people of all faiths, even while prejudice against Islam grows.

item.title: The Political Panel Reacts to the Federal Election
item.description: A Liberal majority. And a provincial election is around the corner. We talk that and more with Tom Rideout, Kay Young and Lukas Norman.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: A Liberal majority. And a provincial election is around the corner. We talk that and more with Tom Rideout, Kay Young and Lukas Norman.
item.itunes:summary: A Liberal majority. And a provincial election is around the corner. We talk that and more with Tom Rideout, Kay Young and Lukas Norman.

item.title: Liberals Sweep Newfoundland
item.description: Judy Foote and Scott Simms were re-elected as Members of Parliament in the newly elected Liberal majority. We talk to them about the results.
item.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
item.itunes:subtitle: Judy Foote and Scott Simms were re-elected as Members of Parliament in the newly elected Liberal majority. We talk to them about the results.
